item.title: How To Easily Fix The Busybox/ Initramfs Error
item.description: Have you ever encountered the above error? It’s pretty annoying, innit? Generally, it’s either called initramfs or busybox error. It typically indicates an issue during the boot process of a Linux system. Initramfs (initial RAM file system) is a temporary file system that is loaded into memory during the boot process before the root file system is mounted. BusyBox is a set of utilities designed for embedded systems, and it is often used in initramfs environment.
